page.title: 05St. Michael's Church, Skidby
page.content: The church is very small and friendly and is surrounded by a closed cemetary. It has one bell which the vicar, Rev. Arthur Hill, rings. Inside the church there is an altar, an organ, a small wooden font and a lectern made of iroko wood. There is a large wooden cross hanging in front of a stained glass window. The vicar wears a light green cassock,an alb,a dark green stole and a girdle when he takes services. There are two or three services on a Sunday; 6 - 10 people attend the 8am service, 35 - 40 people attend the 10am service and 6 - 10 people attend the 6pm service. There are 20 christenings and 6 - 10 marriages a year. The vicar takes weekly assemblies at the small Church of England controlled village school.
